summary: This document is a compilation of three daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for July 24, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and security procedures. The most significant entries track inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status, showing he was on suicide watch in the morning and was later removed to psychological observation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, listed on suicide watch with an inmate companion in the morning log, and later removed from suicide watch to psychological observation in the afternoon log.

persons.name: Burnett
persons.context: Inmate #76254-054, noted as being at a local hospice/nursing facility with USMS guards throughout the logs.

persons.name: Goswami
persons.context: Inmate #75954-054, noted as being taken out to court during the day watch.

persons.name: Martinez
persons.context: Inmate with two different registration numbers (#85976-054 and #27758-050) noted for multiple trips to the local hospital (L-Hosp) and returns.

persons.name: Noble
persons.context: Inmate #78838-054, listed as being removed (likely from the general population) during the day watch.

persons.name: Wright
persons.context: Inmate #84115-083, listed as being removed (likely from the general population) along with inmate Noble during the day watch.

persons.name: Ayllon
persons.context: Inmate #86268-054, listed as being removed (likely transported) at 4:00 AM during the morning watch.

persons.name: Reese
persons.context: Inmate #43667-007, listed as being removed (likely transported to USP Canaan) at 4:00 AM during the morning watch.

persons.name: Hallwood
persons.context: Inmate #63577-054, listed as a new commitment received during the evening watch.

persons.name: Latimer
persons.context: Inmate #79427-054, listed as a new commitment received during the evening watch and later placed in Administrative Detention for a 'CIMS CONCERN'.

persons.name: Rosa
persons.context: Inmate #86324-054, escorted from GN to ZA during the evening watch and placed in Administrative Detention. Contraband including a phone charger, cable, sharpened weapon, and amphetamines was associated with this move.

persons.name: Urena
persons.context: Inmate #28631-054, escorted from GN to ZA during the evening watch along with inmate Rosa and placed in Administrative Detention.

connections.description: Both were inmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the same date, with their statuses (suicide watch/psych obs and at a nursing facility) noted as daily sensitive information.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from suicide watch and placed on psychological observation at 11:10 AM.

events.title: Contraband Discovery and Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmates Rosa and Urena were escorted from unit GN to ZA. Contraband including a phone charger, cable, sharpened weapon, and amphetamines was discovered, leading to their placement in Administrative Detention.

events.title: New Inmate Commitments
events.description: Inmates Hallwood and Latimer were received as new commitments to the facility during the evening watch.

events.title: Fire System Inoperable
events.description: The fire alarm and sprinkler system were reported as non-operational throughout all three shifts, requiring a continuous fire watch.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch with an inmate companion at the start of the day on July 24, 2019.
Epstein was removed from suicide watch and placed on psychological observation at 11:10 AM on July 24, 2019.
The fire alarm and sprinkler system at the MCC were inoperable, requiring a manual fire watch.
Contraband including a sharpened weapon and amphetamines was found on inmates Rosa and Urena, leading to their administrative detention.
The log shows routine inmate movements, court appearances, hospital visits, and new commitments, providing a snapshot of daily operations at the MCC.
